## Return Value

The value for the media `property` key.

# value(forProperty:)

**Instance Method**

Retrieves the value for a specified media property key.

## Declaration

```swift
func value(forProperty property: String) -> Any?
```

## Parameters

- **property**: The media property key that you want the corresponding value of.

## Return Value

The value for the media `property` key.

## Discussion

Use [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPMediaEntity/enumerateValues(forProperties:using:)] to efficiently access more than one property at a time.

To see which media property keys you can use with this method, refer to [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/media-entity-property-keys], [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/general-media-item-property-keys], [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/playlist-property-keys], and [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/user-defined-property-keys].

## Working with media properties

- **canFilter(byProperty:)**: Indicates whether you can use the media property key that you specify to construct a media property predicate.
- **enumerateValues(forProperties:using:)**: Executes a provided block with the fetched values for the given item properties.
- **persistentID**: The persistent identifier for a media entity.
- **subscript(_:)**: Returns the object specified by the key.
- **MPMediaEntityPersistentID**: Defines the type for storing a persistent identifier to a particular entity.
